docs.title: Welcome to Webley
docs.text:
Webley is a modern, lightweight Python web framework designed for speed, simplicity, and developer-friendly design.

Webley makes building web applications straightforward while giving you the flexibility to customize routes, handle requests directly, and control responses. Its minimalistic approach allows you to focus on what really matters—your application logic—without unnecessary boilerplate.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Installing Webley is straightforward and requires minimal setup. It runs on Python 3.10+ without any extra configuration.

docs.title: Installing via PyPI Recommended
docs.text:
The easiest way to install Webley is through PyPI. It’s a one-line command with no additional downloads required.

  1. Open your terminal or command prompt.

  2. Run the installation command:

    pip install webley

  3. Verify the installation:

    python -c "import webley; print('Webley version:', webley.__version__)"

Tip

To keep your project dependencies isolated, consider using a virtual environment:

python -m venv env
source env/bin/activate  # macOS/Linux
env\Scripts\activate     # Windows
pip install webley

docs.title: Installing from GitHub Development Version
docs.text:
For the latest features or if you plan to contribute to Webley, you can install directly from GitHub. This gives you access to updates before they are released on PyPI.

  1. Clone the repository:

    git clone https://github.com/DevByEagle/Webley.git
cd Webley

  2. Install Webley:

    pip install .

  3. Verify the installation:

    python -c "import webley; print('Webley version:', webley.__version__)"

Info

Installing from GitHub is ideal for testing cutting-edge features. For most users, PyPI remains the recommended option.

docs.title: Exceptions
docs.text: Webley provides a structured set of custom exceptions to make error handling clear and predictable. All Webley exceptions inherit from the base `` class.

docs.title: Webley Packages
docs.text:
Below is a list of the core packages included in Webley and their descriptions.

Package Description webley.http Core HTTP request and response classes. Handles incoming requests, responses, headers, and payloads. webley.utils Utility functions and helpers commonly used across the framework.

docs.title: HttpRequest
docs.text:
Represents an HTTP request received by the Webley server. It encapsulates all request data, including the URL path, HTTP method, headers and more.

interface HttpRequest {
    path: string;
    method: string;
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Attribute Description Default path The URL path of the request (e.g., "/", "/users"). "" method The HTTP method used (e.g., "GET", "POST"). "GET"

docs.title: HttpResponse
docs.text:
Represents an HTTP response returned to the client. Allows configuration of the status code, headers, and body content.

interface HttpResponse {
    status_code: number;
    headers: Dictionary<string, string>;
    content: bytes;
}

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: Attribute Description Default status_code The HTTP status code (e.g., 200, 404, 500). 200 content Response body as bytes. b""

docs.text: text(): string Returns the content of the response as a UTF-8 decoded string.
